In his keynote speech Monday at the trade show, Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer rebutted that suggestion. Nokia's support will help Windows Phone overall to build strength versus other mobile platforms, Steve Ballmer said. ''That's not just good for Nokia, that's good for all our handset partners.'' O'Brien: How Nokia and Palm are taking different roads to a comeback

not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012. Mike Pence ruled out a White House bid in a letter sent to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence wrote in the letter. ''In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.''

Both groups have political-action committees that finance candidate campaigns and employ lobbyists in Sacramento, California's capital, the Treasurer's office said. Apparently, it's a practice all over the country, Bill Lockyer said today in a telephone interview. ''I don't think it's a good one.''-- With assistance from Michael B. Marois in Sacramento, California. Editors: Pete Young , Mark Tannenbaum

Because of these changed market conditions as well as the improvements in our performance and outlook made possible through the support of the U.S. and Canadian governments, Chrysler intends to repay these loans in full at the earliest opportunity, he added.

the right thing. I think there are questions about David Cameron 's judgement, about hanging on to him as long as he did.'' TIM BALE, PROFESSOR OF POLITICS, UNIVERSITY OF SUSSEX It's obviously damaging because Andy Coulson was a very effective media operator so he is losing someone who was incredibly useful to the David Cameron operation. It is also incredibly damaging because it questions Mr David Cameron 's judgement and that for a politician is one of the worst things you can possibly do. Being a politician is all about... picking the right people to do the right job and the decision to appoint Andy Coulson was controversial in the first place and it's clearly a big, big judgement call that David Cameron has got wrong. ''I think Andy Coulson was somebody who could help the Conservative Party... produce a message which was, if you like, ''pub ready', which resonated with ordinary people. It wasn''t divorced

Technologies, a provider of the football pads Michael Vick wore most of last season. The deal will be announced on Thursday. ''We're real excited about it,'' chief executive officer Rob Vito said Tuesday. Michael Vick is good people. He paid his dues. Barack Obama reached out to him. He deserves an opportunity. This is what makes America so great. He's moved forward. He's a whole other person. Vito said Michael Vick is the company's first corporate spokesman. Terms of his deal weren't disclosed. that co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as the company's CEO. In a blog post befitting his nice-guy reputation, Eric Schmidt wrote that he was proud of his past decade as CEO and that he was certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! Last year, Farhad Manjoo analyzed whether or not the ex-CEO might have been too nice to keep Google ahead of Apple.
